intro: Clibadium divaricatum, commonly known as the African snakeweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in heads. It is often found growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides, showing adaptability to various environmental conditions. The species is also noted for its use in traditional medicine in some African countries.
